title: Define Project Scope and Requirements - Revised
description: Clearly define the scope, objectives, and requirements for the PhilosophicalGodAI project, including a comprehensive list of philosophical questions to be addressed (e.g., meaning of life, consciousness, free will), the desired level of intelligence (Artificial General Intelligence), the expected capabilities (e.g., natural language processing, machine learning, knowledge representation), the ethical considerations (e.g., potential misuse, transparency, accountability), the impact assessment on society (both short-term and long-term), the plan for addressing any potential risks or concerns, and the importance of continuous monitoring and evaluation to ensure alignment with societal values and safety guidelines. The task also includes refining the project timeline and resource allocation.

title: Conduct Philosophical Research
description: Perform extensive research on various philosophical topics, theories, and debates to gather a comprehensive understanding of the questions to be addressed by the AI system.

title: Design AI Architecture
description: Design the overall architecture and components of the AI system, including neural network architecture, knowledge representation, reasoning mechanisms, learning algorithms, ethical considerations, and outline a strategy for handling vast amounts of philosophical data while ensuring the AI's responses are coherent, thought-provoking, and safe. The design should also address the scalability and performance requirements of the system, considering potential future expansion. Additionally, propose methods to monitor and update the AI's knowledge base regularly.

title: Develop Knowledge Base
description: Create a comprehensive knowledge base to store and organize the philosophical information and data required for the AI system to reason and draw conclusions.

title: Implement AI Components
description: Implement the various components of the AI system, including the neural network, knowledge representation, reasoning engines, and learning algorithms, based on the designed architecture.
